programmes.show_description: The 14 Brits who set off to climb one of New Zealand's highest peaks are down to 10. Having made it to the second base camp, they face a vote-off presided over by host Ben Shephard. As an exhausting snow hike sees the nine remaining climbers tested physically and mentally, call centre worker Sean struggles to keep up, a challenging rope crossing sees influencer Tara forced to find unconventional methods to stay on track, and the Mountain's Keeper sets a dramatic test
News, sport and weather from across Scotland
Natural history meets adrenaline-fuelled entertainment as ocean-phobic celebrities come face-to-face with nature’s most terrifying underwater predators
Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features
Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.
A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions
More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective
The key headlines from the day so far

David Dickinson and his team are in Cirencester, Gloucestershire where a collection of jewellery helps pay for a trip to America and Henry Nicholls can't resist spending more than he wants to for a watch. One of the production team steps in to showcase a vintage dressing gown

Ranvir Singh hosts the quiz as Richard and Elliot, Chantal and Isabelle, and Saul and Akash take on Riddlemaster Henry Lewis. They attempt to answer general knowledge questions and confusing conundrums, with only one team making it through to the high-stakes final with a chance to win a cash prize

Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

Bradley Walsh hosts as Charles from Basildon, Ruth from Leeds, Pam from Nottingham and Aidan from Coventry work as a team to take on one of the experts in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught
A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programmes.show_name: The Martin Lewis Money Show: Live
programmes.show_description: Ahead of tomorrow's Energy Price Cap announcement, Martin shares the crucial information needed to take action when it is confirmed, and also puts viewers' questions to the chief executive of energy regulator Ofgem. Plus, the latest News You Can Use features the best deals of the week
Kim persuades Joe to test Graham's loyalty, while a farm emergency worries Cain

Jodie is tracked down by a girl called Olivia, Bernie threatens to report Mal for breaking into her home, Maggie reminds Lauren who calls the shots, and Steve feels reluctant about visiting his dad in hospital

Nine of the original 14 participants are left as the treacherous terrain and brutal vote-offs claim more victims, and in a dramatic twist the Mountain's Keeper gives one of the group a tough decision to make by choosing someone to leave the mountain. The emotional repercussions of this see everyone beginning to think more strategically, while tensions increase when they are forced to camp in the wild and they start to plot against one another
A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents
Current affairs show tackling the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective, with studio debate and analysis of major stories

programmes.show_name: Cold Case Forensics: The Murder of Lynette White
programmes.show_description: Forensic scientist Dr Angela Gallop and her team detail the methods that helped them crack the 1988 murder of Lynette White in Cardiff. The case had resulted in one of Britain's worst miscarriages of justice, and by 1999 it remained unsolved when a new detective squad brought in Dr Gallop and her forensic team to help solve the case. She and other experts, as well as police officers, lawyers and one of those wrongly accused, tell the story. Nicola Walker narrates

Nine of the original 14 participants are left as the treacherous terrain and brutal vote-offs claim more victims, and in a dramatic twist the Mountain's Keeper gives one of the group a tough decision to make by choosing someone to leave the mountain. The emotional repercussions of this see everyone beginning to think more strategically, while tensions increase when they are forced to camp in the wild and they start to plot against one another

Dermot visits Kinsale in Co Cork, known as the gourmet capital of Ireland, learning about that quintessential Irish ingredient seaweed and taking a chocolate-making masterclass. He then goes foraging for wild garlic before putting together a dish inspired by his travels, with help from a Michelin-starred chef
News, sport and weather from across Scotland

Jeremy is joined in Hong Kong by fellow chef and friend Simon Rimmer as they step into the kitchen to put their own spin on an indulgent prawn toast sandwich, tour the city's old town, and make a pit stop at the city's oldest noodle factory. Jeremy also takes Simon to the hills on a morning cycle ride that is followed by a beachside barbecue where they cook vegetables, chicken wings and pork using Jeremy's secret sauce

The key headlines from the day so far

David Dickinson and his team are in Solihull, West Midlands. Simon Schneider falls in love with a vintage political poster and the Millennium Falcon lands in the den. One seller excitedly cashes in her collection of silver for a new set of wardrobes and a family hopes their battered old violin can make enough money at auction to pay for a trip to Australia

Quiz hosted by Ranvir Singh in which Steve and Jo, Mordecai and Sam, and Chloe and Beth take on Riddlemaster Henry Lewis. They attempt to answer general knowledge questions and confusing conundrums, with only one team making it through to the high-stakes final with a chance to win a cash prize

Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

Bradley Walsh presents as Dianne from Newcastle, Stephen from Essex, Adrian from Cockermouth and Meli from Berkshire pit their wits against one of the Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

Adil Ray hosts the game of words as Countdown's Rachel Riley and radio host Richie Anderson take on screen stars Lesley Joseph and Claire Sweeney in a battle to win big money for charity
Ray's funeral causes concerns, while Vinny is worried about his love life and Kim orders Graham to leave
Bernie tells Kit about Mal's stalking, Shona mislays her wedding ring, Ben takes Tim and Steve on an outing, and Christina and Adam cause headaches for George

Elisa is late to pick up her daughter Lucia from school when Rebecca, the mother of Lucia's new friend, suggests a sleepover for the girls. However, when Elisa goes to pick Lucia up the next morning, she discovers her daughter is missing. Thriller, starring Denise Gough and Holliday Grainger

Political magazine show hosted by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme
